newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan June trade surplus down 21.5 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan June trade surplus down 21.5 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Taiwan had a trade surplus of US$321.9 million in June, down 21.5 percent from a US$410 million surplus in June 1996, the finance ministry said on Monday.
Exports in June totalled US$9.959 billion, up 2.7 percent compared with June 1996.
Imports were US$9.638 billion, up an annual 3.8 percent.

The June trade surplus came in significantly below an average forecast compiled from a July 2 Reuters Poll of Taiwan economists, which projected a surplus of US$492 million -- which would have been a 20 percent rise compared with June 1996.

For the second consecutive month, Hong Kong topped the United States as Taiwan's top export market -- an indication of communist China's growing importance to rival Taiwan's economy. Much of Hong Kong's imports are destined for China, which reclaimed sovereignty over the territory on July 1.
June exports to Hong Kong accounted for 24.5 percent of Taiwan's total exports and a 10.5 percent increase from June 1996 to US$2.441 billion.
Nationalist Taiwan, viewed by Beijing as a renegade province since a civil war split them in 1949, has allowed indirect trade with China since a late 1980s political thaw.
Taipei has said it would allow businesses to continue to use Hong Kong as a conduit for trade with China despite its reabsorption by Beijing.

Taiwan's June exports to the United States totalled US$2.371 billion, accounting for 23.8 percent of the total exports and a 5.7 percent rise from a year ago. Exports to Europe stood at US$1.328 billion in June, comprising 13.3 percent of the total.

Japan remained Taiwan's top import source, accounting for US$2.528 billion or 26.2 percent of the total, followed by the United States at US$1.998 billion (20.7 percent) and Europe at US$1.733 billion (18.0 percent).
Hsu Kuo-chung, the ministry's chief statistician, said he expected both exports and imports to rise between 6-8 percent in the second half of 1997.
"Information and electronic products should be the items that lead the surging growths," Hsu said.
Exports for the electronic and machinery sector, which includes information products, accounted for a hefty 46.2 percent of Taiwan's total June exports at US$4.6 billion.
The same sector comprised 36.6 percent of June imports at US$3.528 billion.
Taiwan's June trade surplus with the United States fell 33.5 percent at US$373.3 million from the same month a year ago.
Its trade surplus with Hong Kong increased 10.2 percent at US$2.293 billion.
Taiwan's trade deficit with Japan was US$1.524 billion, up 56.2 percent from June 1996.
